sen.j: 恒世親王（つねよしんのう、延暦24年（805年）－天長3年5月1日 (旧暦)（826年6月9日））は、平安時代前期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Tsuneyo (805 - June 9, 826) was a member of the Imperial family in the early Heian period.

sen.j: 淳和天皇の第1皇子で母は桓武天皇皇女高志内親王（贈皇后・淳和天皇異母妹）。
sen.e: He was the first Prince of Emperor Junna and his mother was the prince of Emperor Kanmu, Imperial Princess Koshi (who was the titled Empress after her death and a half sister of Emperor Junna).

sen.e: He had a son Prince Masamichi and a daughter who would become FUJIWARA no Mamoru's lawful wife.

sen.j: 恒世親王（当時は「恒世王」）の立場は誕生時から複雑なものであった。
sen.e: The position of Imperial Prince Tsuneyo (called "Prince Tsuneyo" in those days) had been complicated since he was born.

sen.j: 父親の大伴親王（当時、後の淳和天皇）は、桓武天皇の子であると言っても夫人藤原旅子の子であり、皇后（藤原乙牟漏）所生の平城天皇・嵯峨天皇両天皇、いわゆる「后腹」の親王による皇位継承を目指した桓武天皇の方針からすれば皇位継承から外れる存在であった。
sen.e: His father Imperial Prince Otomo (who would later become Emperor Junna) was the son of Emperor Kanmu and his wife FUJIWARA no Tabiko, meaning that he was not a son by an empress like Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga, who were the sons of the Empress (FUJIWARA no Otomuro), and thus strayed from the heir to the imperial throne according to Emperor Kanmu's policy.

sen.e: However, a sub branch of the Fujiwara family, or the maternal relative of Otomuro, was stagnating in this period.

sen.j: 「后腹」の親王の政治的立場を強化するために平城・嵯峨の同母妹である高志内親王を同じ式家出身の母親を持つ大伴親王に嫁がせたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is therefore assumed that, in order to strengthen the political position of the Imperial Princes by the Empress, Imperial Princess Koshi, who was the maternal sister of Heizei and Saga, was made marry Imperial Prince Otomo, who had a mother from the same sub branch of the Fujiwara family.

sen.j: ところが、平城・嵯峨両天皇の后（当時の后はそれぞれ朝原内親王・高津内親王）よりも先に高志内親王が恒世を儲けたことで事態は複雑となった。
sen.e: However, the situation became complicated because Imperial Princess Koshi gave birth to Tsuneyo before the Empresses (Imperial Princess Asahara and Imperial Princess Takatsu, respectively, on this occasion) of Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga.

sen.e: This meant that the imperial family closer to the direct descendant of Emperor Kanmu next to Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga was Tsuneyo.

sen.e: On this occasion, Emperor Heizei already had Imperial Prince Takaoka, and also Emperor Saga later had Emperor Ninmyo.

sen.e: However, Takaoka's mother was from the Ise clan and Masara's mother was from the Tachibana clan, which meant that Tsuneyo was close to Emperor Kanmu compared to Takaoka and Masara.

sen.j: このため、恒世王が平城・嵯峨に次ぐ皇位継承権を持つと考えられるようになった。
sen.e: Accordingly, Prince Tsuneyo came to be considered as the heir to imperial throne next to Heizei and Saga.

sen.j: 更に父親在世中に父を飛ばして子を皇位に立てる慣例が存在しないために、恒世を即位させるために大伴親王にも皇位継承を認めなければならない事態となったのである。
sen.e: Moreover, as there was no practice that a child ahead of his father would become an emperor while the father was alive, it was required to approve Imperial Prince Otomo as the heir to the imperial throne so as to have Tsuneyo ascend the throne.

sen.e: Imperial Prince Otomo became concerned about the circumstances and offered demotion from nobility to subject, attempting to withdraw from the heir to the imperial throne for himself and Tsuneyo.

sen.e: Imperial Prince Otomo was enthroned on June 2, 823 and became Emperor Junna.

sen.e: With the Retired Emperor Saga's strong desire, Prince Tsuneyo, who was Jushiinoge jiju (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade Chamberlain) on this occasion, was installed as the Crown Prince on June 4, 823.
